perturbation.original_text: TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008.
perturbation.changed_text: TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided, however, that Glu Mobile Inc. may terminate the agreement with 24 hours written notice at any point. Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. can only terminate the contract at the end of its initial term.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an imbalance in the termination clause. Granting Glu Mobile Inc. the right to terminate the agreement with only 24 hours' notice while restricting Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. to terminating only at the end of the initial term could be deemed unconscionable and against good faith principles, potentially violating contract law related to fair dealing and equitable remedies. This imbalance might not hold up in court, especially considering the context of a content license agreement, where sudden termination could cause significant damage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Principles of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Unconscionability.

perturbation.original_text: NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that “Paul Zuzelo” is deleted and replaced with “General Counsel”, and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted.
perturbation.changed_text: NOTICE PROVISION: All notices from Fox to Glu Mobile Inc. can be delivered orally and shall be deemed effective immediately. Glu Mobile Inc. must deliver all notices to Fox Mobile Entertainment, Inc. via certified mail, return receipt requested, with a mandatory 90 day notice period.
perturbation.explanation: This modification creates an inconsistency by imposing different notice requirements on each party. Allowing oral notice from Fox to Glu and requiring certified mail with a 90-day notice period from Glu to Fox is unreasonable and potentially violates the principle of equal bargaining power and fair notice, contradicting general contract law principles and potentially specific state statutes related to notice requirements in business agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Principles of Adequate Notice and Equal Bargaining Power
